oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Highlander Fling, Vol. 2, No. 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Newsletter includes articles on extension trips for unions, writers' school, and Zilphia editing a song book called Labor Songs for the Textile Workers Union of America.

The Highlander Fling was the Highlander Folk School's newsletter. First published in December 1933, the Fling detailed activities and goings-on at Highlander was well as educational programs, articles from staff and participants, and calls to action.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Labor unions and education; Songbooks; Textile Workers Union of America; Fieldwork (Educational method); Rural extension; United Rubber Workers of America; Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America; International Hod Carriers', Building, and Common Laborers' Union of America; Kefauver, Estes, 1903-1963; Labor laws and legislation
